revised_title: Observation of Brain Sphacelation and Stone Found in the Brain
tldr: Edward Tyson describes the case of a patient who suffered a head injury and subsequently developed symptoms such as vomiting, convulsions, and memory loss. Upon autopsy, Tyson discovered that the left hemisphere of the patient's brain was severely damaged and rotten, and a stone was found in the brain's substance. This rare occurrence highlights the importance of understanding brain pathology and its effects on the body.
